Ingredients.3: 1 (19 ounce) package mild Italian sausage (such as Johnsonville®)

Ingredients.7: 2 teaspoons dried basil, or more to taste

Ingredients.8: 2 teaspoons dried oregano, or more to taste

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Put olive oil on the bottom of a medium-sized baking dish. Remove casings from sausage.

Directions.2: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook cabbage leaves until tender, about 12 minutes. Drain.

Directions.3: While the cabbage is cooking, remove casings from sausage. Cook and stir sausage in a skillet over medium-high heat, breaking it into pieces as it cooks, until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard grease.

Directions.4: At the same time, combine marinara sauce and tomato sauce in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook until warm, about 3 minutes; set aside.

Directions.5: Mix cooked rice, sausage, and 1/2 cup sauce with basil and oregano. Spread filling onto cabbage leaves and roll up like small burritos. The amount of filling in each will vary depending on how big your cabbage leaves are. Place cabbage rolls close together in the prepared dish and spoon remaining sauce over top.

Directions.6: Bake in the preheated oven until cooked through, about 30 minutes. Garnish with more basil and oregano.
